description.narrative:
Stakeholders: The most significant project outcome is the increased provision of quality and affordable diagnostics services in China. The Project also aims at relieving the overcapacity issue at tertiary hospitals in China while enhancing the testing service offerings at secondary and primary hospitals.
Resilience: The Project will help increase overall testing capabilities and hopefully have a spillover effect in terms of building resilience against future pandemics in emerging markets around the world.
Market Impact: The key market impact is the facilitation of reduction in prices of critical healthcare diagnoses through centralization and increased throughput and efficiency of lab testing. The project will lead to better quality and more accessible tests to the general public as well as demonstration effect to increase the number of market participants.

The proposed investment will support DiAn Diagnostics Group Co., Ltd. (DiAn, the Company or the Borrower) to (i) expand and upgrade its existing ICL network and create 5 regional test centers through expansion of existing ICLs; (ii) add 5 spoke ICLs in second/third tier cities; (iii) build a manufacturing center for its self-developed In Vitro Diagnostic (IVD) products; (iv) fund R&D expenses to accelerate expansion in specialized testing and (v) build advanced IT infrastructure and data analytics function over the next five years (together, the Project). The additional testing capacity created by the Project will help to relieve capacity constraints at over-crowded public hospitals while expanding the types of testing available.
